title: Direct Commands
explanationEnUs: The Imperative Mood uses the base form of the verb to give commands or instructions.
explanationZhTw: 祈使語氣使用動詞原形來發出命令或指示。
explanationZhCn: 祈使语气使用动词原形来发出命令 or 指示。

title: Negative Commands
content: [Do not|No] run in the hallway. [Don't|Not] forget your keys.
explanationEnUs: Negative commands are formed with 'Do not' or 'Don't' + base verb.
explanationZhTw: 否定命令由 'Do not' 或 'Don't' + 動詞原形構成。
explanationZhCn: 否定命令由 'Do not' or 'Don't' + 动词原形构成。

title: Polite Requests
content: Please [take|taking] a seat. [Pass|Passing] me the salt, please.
explanationEnUs: Adding 'please' makes the imperative more polite, but the verb form remains the base form.
explanationZhTw: 加上 'please' 使祈使句更有禮貌，但動詞形式保持原形。
explanationZhCn: 加上 'please' 使祈使句更有礼貌，但动词形式保持原形。

title: Instructions
content: First, [chop|chopping] the onions. Then, [add|added] them to the pan.
explanationEnUs: Imperatives are commonly used in recipes and instructions.
explanationZhTw: 祈使句常用於食譜和說明中。
explanationZhCn: 祈使句常用于食谱和说明中。

title: Let's Suggestions
content: Let's [go|going] to the park. Let's not [argue|arguing] about this.
explanationEnUs: 'Let's' (Let us) is used to make suggestions including the speaker. The verb is in the base form.
explanationZhTw: 'Let's' (Let us) 用於提出包含說話者的建議。動詞使用原形。
explanationZhCn: 'Let's' (Let us) 用于提出包含说话者的建议。动词使用原形。
